abstract: Stocks staged a late rally today on Wall Street after a day of wild swings  as investors weighed the impact of the crunch in the American credit market.
snippet: Stocks staged a late rally today on Wall Street after a day of wild swings  as investors weighed the impact of the crunch in the American credit market.
lead_paragraph: Stocks staged a late rally today on Wall Street after a day of wild swings as investors continued to weigh the impact of the crunch in the American credit market.

headline.main: Dow Drops 340 Points, Then Recovers Losses

byline.original: By Jeremy W. Peters and Wayne Arnold

abstract: The Dow Jones industrial average closed down 167.45 points after having stayed in positive territory for most of the day.
snippet: The Dow Jones industrial average closed down 167.45 points after having stayed in positive territory for most of the day.
lead_paragraph: Stocks fell sharply late yesterday afternoon, and one broad market index turned negative for the year as investors again questioned the economy’s ability to withstand financial shocks and higher borrowing costs.

headline.main: More Jitters Over Credit; Markets Fall
headline.print_headline: More Jitters Over Credit; Markets Fall

byline.original: By Vikas Bajaj and Jenny Anderson

abstract: The Dow Jones industrial average was down in early trading after the nation’s top mortgage lender sought to shore up its cash position and a report showed that construction of new homes fell in July.
snippet: The Dow Jones industrial average was down in early trading after the nation’s top mortgage lender sought to shore up its cash position and a report showed that construction of new homes fell in July.
lead_paragraph: Stocks opened sharply lower on Wall Street today after a sell-off in Asia and heavy losses in Europe, the latest reverberations of the credit crunch stemming from the reversals in the American mortgage market.

headline.main: U.S. Stocks Open Lower After Major Asian Sell-Off

byline.original: By Vikas Bajaj and Wayne Arnold
